chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
c: lb
b: lb
a: lb

Goal:
a ↑ b ↓ c ≂ (a ↑ b) ↓ (a ↑ c)

Premises:
lb_meet_length : forall a b : lb, length a = length b -> length (a ↓ b) = length a
lb_mask_join : forall a b : lb, a ⪯ b < -> a ↑ b ≂ b
lb_join_mono : forall l m a b : lb, l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ↑ a ⪯ m ↑ b
lb_join_inc_right : forall a b : lb, b ⪯ a ↑ b
lb_join_inc_left : forall a b : lb, a ⪯ a ↑ b
lb_meet_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> (l ++ a) ↓ (m ++ b) = l ↓ m ++ a ↓ b
lb_mask_meet : forall a b : lb, a ⪯ b < -> a ↓ b ≂ a
lb_join_eq : forall x y : lb, x ≂ y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> x ↑ x0 ≂ y ↑ y0
lb_join_idem : forall a : lb, a ↑ a = a
lb_meet_mono : forall l m a b : lb, l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ↓ a ⪯ m ↓ b
lb_meet_dec_right : forall a b : lb, a ↓ b ⪯ b
lb_meet_dec_left : forall a b : lb, a ↓ b ⪯ a
in_eq : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), In a (a :: l)
lb_join_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↑ m = m ↑ l
lb_join_eq_Proper = fun (x y : lb) (H : x ≂ y) (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun (x1 y1 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y1) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => fun (x2 y2 : lb) (H4 : x2 ≂ y2) => match H4 with | conj H5 H6 => conj (lb_join_mono H2 H5) (lb_join_mono H3 H6) end end) x y H x0 y0 H0 : Morphisms.Proper (lb_mask_equiv ==> lb_mask_equiv ==> lb_mask_equiv) lb_join Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_join_eq_Proper : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y ->...-> x ↑ x0 ⪯ y ↑ y0 /\ y ↑ y0 ⪯ x ↑ x0 Arguments lb_join_eq_Proper [x y] _ [x0 y0]
lb_join_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), (x :: l) ↑ (y :: m) = x || y :: l ↑ m
lb_meet_eq : forall x y : lb, x ≂ y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> x ↓ x0 ≂ y ↓ y0
lb_join_right : forall x : lb, nil ↑ x = x
lb_join_left : forall x : lb, x ↑ nil = x
lb_meet_idem : forall a : lb, a ↓ a = a
lb_mask_equiv_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> l ≂ m -> a ≂ b -> l ++ a ≂ m ++ b
lb_meet_left : forall x : lb, x ↓ nil ≂ nil
lb_meet_right : forall x : lb, nil ↓ x ≂ nil
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
lb_meet_eq_Proper = fun (x y : lb) (H : x ≂ y) (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun (x1 y1 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y1) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => fun (x2 y2 : lb) (H4 : x2 ≂ y2) => match H4 with | conj H5 H6 => conj (lb_meet_mono H2 H5) (lb_meet_mono H3 H6) end end) x y H x0 y0 H0 : Morphisms.Proper (lb_mask_equiv ==> lb_mask_equiv ==> lb_mask_equiv) lb_meet Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_meet_eq_Proper : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y ->...-> x ↓ x0 ⪯ y ↓ y0 /\ y ↓ y0 ⪯ x ↓ x0 Arguments lb_meet_eq_Proper [x y] _ [x0 y0]
lb_join_length_le : forall (n : nat) (l m : lb), length l <= n -> length m <= n -> length (l ↑ m) <= n
lb_ortho_meet_nil : forall x y : lb, x ⟂ y < -> x ↓ y ≂ nil
lb_pointwise_mono_left : forall f : bool -> bool -> bool, (forall x a b : bool, a ⪦ b -> f x a ⪦ f x b) -> f ⟘ ⟘ = ⟘ -> forall l m k : lb, l ⪯ m -> lb_pointwise f k l ⪯ lb_pointwise f k m
lb_meet_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↓ m = m ↓ l
Ring.BoolTheory = {| Ring_theory.Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then ⟙ else ⟘) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟙ b = xorb b ⟙) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟘ b = xorb b ⟘) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb ⟙ (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb ⟙ b) z) then fun z : bool =>...
